content.description:
Start as for 'Two Buck Chuck', in the undercling sidepulls with some tricky footwork, but head left. Reach to the dish on the prow, and pull the lip on slopers and a tricky mantel.

Another surprisingly fun mini boulder.
content.location:
Two Buck Boulder, 30 or so feet downhill (toward the ocean) from Morning Glory.

The small boulder with the overhang.

content.description: Sit down start on the two undercling sidepulls. Use some footwork trickery to pull on and slap chuck to a sloper out right. Get established on the lip and mantel.
content.location:
Toward the ocean from Morning Glory, about 30 feet down hill.

Look for the small overhanging boulder with nice grass growing beneath.

content.description:
Start with your right hand on a small nubbin and your left in a sloping dish on the arete. Make some technical and balancy moves using crimps and small pockets to reach the deep hueco and easier ground.

The shorter inclined may have to stack pads to reach the dish.
content.location: Down and to the right of Morning Glory. While standing at the base of Morning Glory you are practically on top of this climb.

content.description:
Sit start with a left hand on a slanted edge and a very low right hand on a rail. Make your way up to the stand start using some bizarre compression trickery.

Looks harder than it is.
content.location: Sit start to The Sunrise Tango

content.description: Highstep onto the white face of immaculate patina and cruise to the top. One of the most scenic problems around.
content.location: Follow the approach trail past the Warm-Up boulders. Directly in front of you there is a large outcropping with an intimidating left leaning face. Morning Glory is on the opposite side of the formation from where you are. It is possible to skirt the formation to either the left or right.

content.description: Start low on crimps,move up and out using slopers.
content.location: Just to the left of morning glory. Its a free standing boulder. It starts on the side that faces the pier.

content.description: Ride the escalator on the far left side, with the big blocky angled ledges. Follow them up and right to the horizontal sloping ledge. Mantel up and away.
content.location: Left side of boulder on jugs.

content.description:
Sit down start with left hand on a sloper pinch just over the lip and right hand on the right angled pinch under the lip.

Bust some good moves up to the big appetizing pocket and then transfer left into the small corner and easier terrain.

Enjoy the excellent view and awesome 'throne' on top.
content.location:
On the same boulder as 'Pocket Change'. The overhanging prow, low to the ground.

Downhill from Morning Glory. Directly behind (toward the ocean) from 'Stairway to Heaven' boulder.

content.description:
"They're stranded in a dangerous, desolate location, without food or water, and they're completely naked."

Start matched in a left facing undercling in the mini-cave / hueco at waist-height, center of the boulder.  Make a couple moves to gain the top of the mini-bulge and use a pocket foothold out left to make the crux throw for the top!

Potential for a sit-start down and to the right beginning on a juggy-ledge.

**Disclaimer: As always, lmk if this has been done before!**
content.location:
Located South-East of the Morning Glory slab, facing the ocean.  Naked and Afraid is about parallel from the Stairway to Heaven/ Pocket Change boulders.

From Morning Glory, look towards the ocean.

Down hill and to the left you'll see a prominent stone formation in the distance.  Naked and Afraid is found enroute to this formation.

content.description:
Start on the two pockets at chest height. Make a crux move to the next good pocket, and then have a blast using a great variety of crimps, pockets and slopers to gain the top. Great climbing in a great location!

The sit start is open project, adding a couple very hard moves. Will certainly bump the line up multiple duckets(??) and **s(??). The crimps are there, and they're solid, it's just... really hard.
content.location:
Downhill from Morning Glory slab.

Follow the (slowly improving) trail towards the ocean. Look for the large boulder that looks like a weird staircase (Stairway to Heaven boulder). The Pocket Change boulder is directly below (squeeze through the small cave or walk around). Pocket Change is on the ocean side of the boulder.

content.description:
Start as for Kings Corner, with left hand sloper over the lip and right hand pinch under the lip.

Follow the arete/face up and right, exiting right over the adjacent rock.
content.protection: Pad(s). Traverses right over adjacent rock.
content.location:
Downhill from Morning Glory.

Same boulder as Pocket Change.

content.description:
Two variations:

Direct, SDS directly under the stand of Pocket Change, and two tiny, sharp but incut crimps. Make some hard pulls and join directly into Pocket Change. V8-9ish

Start down and right, on a sidepull for and a nice pinch. Toss a heel, lock it off and join back left into Pocket Change. V7-8ish
content.location: Downhill, towards the ocean from Morning Glory

content.description: Start on the far left of the boulder on a thin seam. Traverse right and up along the seam below the miniroof, reaching the undercling flake and then the jug. Head straight up from here, making a big move from a pinch to the ledge. Stand up and proceed to heaven.
content.protection:
Pads. Spotters for that table rock behind.

Watch for suspect rock.
content.location:
Directly below Morning Glory (toward the ocean). About 2 minutes walk.

Between Morning Glory and the Dragon boulders.

climbs.name: Mr. Wrinkles, the Irritable Insurance Salesman

content.description: Start to the right of Morning Glory. Follow the water runoff funnel to the top. The rock is worse quality, and the start is a bit more awkward. Still fun if you're in the area.
